Description: Small portrait head probably representing Alexander the Great. The head turns slightly to its right on the neck. The hair falls in long locks around the brow and onto the neck and is bound by a diadem at the crown. The facial features are damaged but resemble those of portraits of Alexander.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Robert Murdoch Smith
Excavated by: Cdr Edwin A Porcher
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (1454)
